segments.pli: “Kammalakkhaṇo, bhikkhave, bālo, kammalakkhaṇo paṇḍito, apadānasobhanī paññāti.
segments.en: “A fool is characterized by their deeds; an astute person is characterized by their deeds. And wisdom is evident in its outcome.

segments.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bālo veditabbo.
segments.en: A fool is known by three things.
Bad conduct by way of body, speech, and mind.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato bālo veditabbo.
segments.en: These are the three things by which a fool is known.

segments.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato paṇḍito veditabbo.
segments.en: An astute person is known by three things.
Good conduct by way of body, speech, and mind.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato paṇḍito veditabbo.
segments.en: These are the three things by which an astute person is known.
So you should train like this:

segments.pli: ‘yehi tīhi dhammehi samannāgato bālo veditabbo te tayo dhamme abhinivajjetvā, yehi tīhi dhammehi samannāgato paṇḍito veditabbo te tayo dhamme samādāya vattissāmā’ti.
segments.en: ‘We will reject the three things by which a fool is known, and we will undertake and follow the three things by which an astute person is known.’
